column2: Anadarko Petroleum raises 2014 capex budget by about 8 pct March 4 Anadarko Petroleum Corp raised its 2014 capital budget by nearly 8 percent and said it would spend about 60 percent of the total on drilling more oil wells onshore in North America.

column2: Caterpillar CEO "guardedly optimistic" about global economy March 4 Caterpillar Inc's chief executive said on Tuesday several of the company's biggest markets
column3: including China and North America
column4: were strengthening modestly
column5: but he warned that the global economy was largely fragile and sensitive to unexpected shocks like the crisis in Ukraine.

column2: Pentagon budget scraps two Lockheed satellites
column3: postpones othersUPDATE 2-Pentagon aims to replace Raytheon missile "kill vehicle" WASHINGTON
column4: March 4 The U.S. Defense Department's fiscal 2015 budget includes $8.5 billion in funding for missile defense programs and reaffirms the Obama administration's plan to build 14 additional ground-based interceptors by 2017.  UPDATE 2-Pentagon aims to replace Raytheon missile "kill vehicle" WASHINGTON
column5: March 4 The U.S. Defense Department's fiscal 2015 budget includes $8.5 billion in funding for missile defense programs and reaffirms the Obama administration's plan to build 14 additional ground-based interceptors by 2017. WASHINGTON
column6: March 4 The U.S. Defense Department said its 2015 budget request includes $7.2 billion for satellites and other space-based programs but saves $2.1 billion over the next five years by scrapping plans for two Lockheed Martin Corp communications satellites.UPDATE 2-Pentagon aims to replace Raytheon missile "kill vehicle" WASHINGTON
column7: March 4 The U.S. Defense Department's fiscal 2015 budget includes $8.5 billion in funding for missile defense programs and reaffirms the Obama administration's plan to build 14 additional ground-based interceptors by 2017.

column2: Microsoft makes pollster Penn head of strategy
column3: exact role unclear SEATTLE Microsoft Corp on Monday put pugnacious pollster and political adviser Mark Penn in charge of strategy but left company watchers uncertain what exactly his new role will entail.
